answerText: FISH [or Fluorescence In Situ Hybridization][10] FISH is often used to find gene duplications. Gene duplications of certain genes can cause this condition, in which cells grow out of control and form tumors.
heading: NASAT |2014 | 1 | 21 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This technique commonly uses a twenty-nucleotide probe and requires permeabilization of the target cells. [10] Name this technique in which a fluorescently-labelled strand of DNA is injected into a cell in order to find particular DNA segments.
